title: Import [of profile] failed unexpectedly, Error Console - "Uncaught (in promise) DOMException: Could not open the file at..."
content:
I reinstalled Windows, then moved my last profile (*.default) from my backup drive to the new Profiles folder at C:\Users\...\AppData\Roaming\Thunderbird.

Tapping Tools > Import > Import from another Thunderbird installation > Choose a profile folder, I tried to import this last *.default profile.

It failed, Error console message Uncaught (in promise) DOMException: Could not open the file at C:\Users\...\AppData\Roaming\Thunderbird\Profiles\zayx7k8l.default\prefs.js.

Because no prefs.js in *.default? Why would it not be there? Does that mean I've lost everything?

Anyone's help greatly appreciated.
creator: AndrewDillon

title: Scrollbar lands randomly in list of archived messages
content: Immediately after upgrading to Supernova, I find that when I click on any of my folders of archived messages in the Message Pane, the scrollbar often goes to a random file somewhere in the middle -- i.e., an old message -- rather than to the most recent one (at the bottom) or even to the most recently viewed message. This happens intermittently, unpredictably - but often enough to be annoying. Has anyone else noticed this?
creator: BlebNevus1015

title: Connect error 10051, only on wifi
content:
I have a problem. When I connect the computer to the internet through the normal wifi, Thunderbird wont connect. All other programs using internet access, like browsers, etc, work perfectly well, but not Thunderbird. Normally, it wont either download or send outgoing e-mails. Sometimes it works, but only very slow and taking very long time.

But, if I turn on the Mobile Hotspot on my cellphone and connect the computer to the internet through the phone, then Thunderbird works perfect well.

I'm normally using the computer on two different wifi networks, and Thunderbird behaves the exact same way on both these networks. But as soon as I connect the computer to the cellphone hotspot, then it works perfectly well.

The error message is (in Swedish), or another one, see attachment: "Det gick inte att skicka meddelandet. Ett fel uppstod när e-post skulle skickas: Utgående serverfel (SMTP). Servern svarade: Cannot connect to SMTP server 109.235.175.122 (109.235.175.122:587), connect error 10051."

Why does Thunderbird work only when the computer is connected to the internet through the cellphone and not through the wifi wireless router?
creator: robertrask76

title: I want my manually deleted mail to automatically be marked as read
content:
With new version unread messages are indicated to brightly. And it's annoying to much especially for the trash folder.

Here https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1266204#question-reply this topic already discussed and I agree, if it's moved by rules, we may mark mail as read there.

But I delete mails manually withing "del" key on keyboard. And I don't want to see deleted mails as unread in trash folder.

How to mark mail as read if I remove it manually using keyboard?

Thanks, Mikhail

title: Can't re=open after minimising

creator: kirkstall

title: Thunderbird Supernova načtení .eml
content: Bohužel jsme zjistili, že pokud chceme načíst .eml soubor vygenerovaný naším ERP systémem, tak zatímco starší verze předmět správně stejně jako Outlook vyplnila, v nové verzi Thunderbird předmět po otevření asociovaného .eml úplně chybí, vyplní se jen adresát. U posílání vícero faktur je to bohužel velká nepříjemnost (testováno se stejným .eml souborem, kde Outlook předmět vyplní, ale nový Thunderbird Supernova nikoliv). Takže bychom byli rádi, kdyby toto bylo opět funkční, případně pokud by někdo věděl, kde tohle lze na nové verzi zapnout, předem děkuji. Thunderbird 15.3.2(nová instalace i upgradovaná ze starších verzí) + Windows 10 pro
creator: it9

title: Need help with recovering a very old Thunderbird Profile backup
content:
I've got an old profile (old emails) that I'm trying to resurrect. I don't know how old this profile is but 5+years isn't unreasonable and possibly closer to 10. I have the old Profiles directory backed up. Backed up as a copy (not as an export or zip). I've not been able to get Thunderbird to load the messages however.

I've tried the various instructions for creating new profiles, pointing to the directory, editing the profiles.ini (both relatively=1 and explictly=0) and I don't see the messages showing up. The existing documentation doesn't seem to cover whatever problem I'm running into.

I'm not seeing error messages show up either so I'm not sure what to do at this point. Any recommendations on what I can do to try to recover these old emails? I see the headers are there but the body is ?compressed?. It's not std ascii.

Thank you.
creator: eastc

title: Domain Change Settings Question - Manual Config - Folder Organization
content: Hello All, I recently changed my service provider from GoDaddy to Strikingly. I changed my Thunderbird account info accordingly and all was working fine until a computer crash which ultimately resulted in that account reverting back to GoDaddy settings. As a result my latest downloaded email showing for this account is from July (of 2023). I've changed the settings again in Thunderbird, but the account is hardwired to POP3 (GoDaddy) instead of IMAP (Strikingly) and won't link to the server. I assume I will need to do a manual account configuration to change this. Before jumping in I just need to warm up my cold feet and make SURE that when I do this I won't be losing all of the folder organization for years and years of business emails which only exists in Thunderbird. Please, please reassure me! Thank you so much, M. Britz
creator: guemeskid

title: Keeps downloading thousands of emails.   There are not thousands of emails to download
content:
I was hoping to get to the actual customer support as I've exhausted the forum I think.

Thunderbird keeps telling me it is downloading <number> of 26,800+ or sometimes it is of 36,000+ emails. I've deleted the the pop file (even though its IMAP) I deleted the mail file. I re-download and reinstalled. And still when I launch it starts downloading this huge chunk of emails.

At the server, there are less than 500 emails on the server. No idea where it is finding tens of thousands of emails from.

As you can imagine, Thunderbird freezes up and might be responsible for my computer shutting down without warning from time to time as I imagine that take up a lot of the swap memory.

This is a gmail account. Its not doing this with any of the other non gmail accounts. Is there some know bug with thunderbird and gmail maybe?

I did not delete completely, as I have about 7 email ids in thunderbird - I just installed over the top hoping any glitch would get overwritten, but no luck.

Image of the note included, just so you see I am not dreaming.

Thunderbird 115.3.4 64 bit version on Win 10

title: Sorting By "Order Received" Has Changed!? (115.3.2 64bit)
content:
I used to be able to sort messages by "Order Received" WITHOUT displaying it as a COLUMN in the display. NOW - if I don't have "Order Received" displaying as a column, the "Order Received" sort option is "greyed-out"! For me, at least, the information showing in the "Order Received" column is useless and unwanted, and I hate to waste COLUMN SPACE to display information that I don't need. Please allow users to sort our messages by "Order Received" WITHOUT having to display it in a column. Thanks! :-)

Since I initially wrote the above text, someone made the following suggestion which helped a lot, but didn't SOLVE the problem: As with your problem the sort option for "Order Received" is greyed out. I have managed to fudge it by displaying the "Order Received" column, enabling the sort by "Order Received" then "undisplaying" the "Order Received" column. The sort order is retained.

I'm requesting that Thunderbird Supernova programmers please FIX the program so it can sort by any possible category REGARDLESS of whether a column is/was displayed for it. Thanks very much!  :-)
creator: LREmery
